course.subject: PPOL
course.name: Policy Impact Evaluation
course.description: Significant resources are dedicated to programs and policies however, what degree of confidence can observed changes in an outcome be attributed to a given intervention, program or policy? What are the characteristics of evaluation designs, quantitative and qualitative data collection methods, and analyses that allow empirically defensible Impact Evaluation of policy or program? The purpose of this course is to explore how questions of this kind are conceptualized and investigated. Students will learn about impact evaluation by examining evaluation designs and causal modelling techniques and by performing fundamental evaluation tasks. To explore how impact evaluation is situated and used, students will examine the guidelines that are in circulation. As way to build professional skill set needed to conduct evaluations, students will engage in evaluation application activities.
